member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.CharacterFormat.Formatted
member.summary: If true, some special sequences can be used in the string to change it's appearance.
member.remarks:
The formatting sequences are:
#CRRGGBB Changes color of the text. RR, GG and BB are hexadecimal values of appropriate color channels.
#C- Changes color of the text to the one before last use of #CRRGGBB command.
Can be used multiple times: #CFF0000 Red #C00FF00 Green #C0000FF Blue #C- Green #C- Red
#B+ and #B- Sets and unsets the bold font style.
#I+ and #I- Sets and unsets the italics font style.
#U+ and #U- Sets and unsets the underline font style.
## Writes the # character (as it is not possible to write it by '#' character).

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.CharacterFormat.FilledBounds
member.summary: Instead of characters, only bounding rectangles are drawn.
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be masked and at the same time text is drawn by several brushes.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.CharacterFormat.IgnoreColorFormatting
member.summary: Color formattig marks will be ignored. (Applicable only when Formatted is true.)
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be used as mask and we want all the text to be drawn by same brush.

member.summary: Adds newline characters to wrap lines to fit given width.
member.remarks:
This method adds characters into SDUFormattedString so every Position and Interval structures becomes invalid.
This method is called by StringDrawUtils to wrap lines to fit a rectangle.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.SDUFormattedString.WrapSingleLine(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Adds newline characters into single line to make it fit given width.
member.remarks:
This function changes character numbers of SDUFormattedString so every user Position and Interval structures becomes invalid.
Also as we save positions of newly added newline characters, WrapSingleLine calls must go from left to right - to not damage previously saved positions.

Angle of InitialFormat (specified at construction) has to be zero.
BackgroundBrush

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Window
member.summary: DCX_WINDOW: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Cache
member.summary: DCX_CACHE: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.NoResetAttrs
member.summary: DCX_NORESETATTRS: Does not reset the attributes of this DC to the default attributes when this DC is released.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ClipChildren
member.summary: DCX_CLIPCHILDREN: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ClipSiblings
member.summary: DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ParentClip
member.summary: DCX_PARENTCLIP: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeRgn
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDERGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.IntersectRgn
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTRGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeUpdate
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.IntersectUpdate
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.LockWindowUpdate
member.summary: DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Validate
member.summary: DCX_VALIDATE When specified with DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE, causes the DC to be completely validated. Using this function with both DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE and DCX_VALIDATE is identical to using the BeginPaint function.

member.summary: Angle of string's rotation. (Clockwise)

member.summary: HotkeyPrefix of the string.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.CharacterFormat.Formatted
member.summary: If true, some special sequences can be used in the string to change it's appearance.
member.remarks:
The formatting sequences are:
#CRRGGBB Changes color of the text. RR, GG and BB are hexadecimal values of appropriate color channels.
#C- Changes color of the text to the one before last use of #CRRGGBB command.
Can be used multiple times: #CFF0000 Red #C00FF00 Green #C0000FF Blue #C- Green #C- Red
#B+ and #B- Sets and unsets the bold font style.
#I+ and #I- Sets and unsets the italics font style.
#U+ and #U- Sets and unsets the underline font style.
## Writes the # character (as it is not possible to write it by '#' character).

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.CharacterFormat.FilledBounds
member.summary: Instead of characters, only bounding rectangles are drawn.
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be masked and at the same time text is drawn by several brushes.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ScheduleSet.Calendars.Common.Common.CharacterFormat.IgnoreColorFormatting
member.summary: Color formattig marks will be ignored. (Applicable only when Formatted is true.)
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be used as mask and we want all the text to be drawn by same brush.
